Key Match Events: Mark Wood and Liam Livingstone took three wickets apiece as England battled back in their T20 World Cup clash with Ireland at the MCG.
Andrew Balbirnie impressed with 62 off 47 balls.
Adil Rashid deflected Balbirnie’s drive on to the stumps at the non-striker’s end to run-out Lorcan Tucker for 34, ending an 82-run stand in 57 balls.
Ireland were all out for 157 from 19.2 overs.
Mark Wood finished with three for 34.
Liam Livingstone finished with an international best three for 17.
Sam Curran bowled both Barry McCarthy and Fionn Hand.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England were out of sorts after electing to field first.
Following two brief rain delays, Ireland racked up 103 for one before a fortunate run-out.
Ireland lost their last seven wickets for 25 runs in 24 balls.
England elected against shuffling their bowlers, with Australia to come in two days.
Ireland raced to 59 for one from the powerplay then reached 100 in the 12th over.
Chris Woakes conceded 41 from three overs, while Curran also went at more than 10 an over.
